The song<S>7892</S> of songs<S>7892</S>, which is Solomon's<S>8010</S>.
Let him kiss<S>5401</S> me with the kisses<S>5390</S> of his mouth<S>6310</S>: for thy love<S>1730</S> is better<S>2896</S> than wine<S>3196</S>. <sup>thy: Heb. thy loves</sup>
Because of the savour<S>7381</S> of thy good<S>2896</S> ointments<S>8081</S> thy name<S>8034</S> is as ointment<S>8081</S> poured forth<S>7324</S>, therefore do the virgins<S>5959</S> love<S>157</S> thee.
Draw<S>4900</S> me, we will run<S>7323</S> after<S>310</S> thee: the king<S>4428</S> hath brought<S>935</S> me into his chambers<S>2315</S>: we will be glad<S>1523</S> and rejoice<S>8055</S> in thee, we will remember<S>2142</S> thy love<S>1730</S> more than wine<S>3196</S>: the upright<S>4339</S> love<S>157</S> thee. <sup>the upright: or, they love thee uprightly</sup>
I am black<S>7838</S>, but comely<S>5000</S>, O ye daughters<S>1323</S> of Jerusalem<S>3389</S>, as the tents<S>168</S> of Kedar<S>6938</S>, as the curtains<S>3407</S> of Solomon<S>8010</S>.
Look<S>7200</S> not upon me, because I am black<S>7840</S>, because the sun<S>8121</S> hath looked<S>7805</S> upon me: my mother's<S>517</S> children<S>1121</S> were angry<S>2787</S> with me; they made<S>7760</S> me the keeper<S>5201</S> of the vineyards<S>3754</S>; but mine own vineyard<S>3754</S> have I not kept<S>5201</S>.
Tell<S>5046</S> me, O thou whom my soul<S>5315</S> loveth<S>157</S>, where thou feedest<S>7462</S>, where<S>349</S> thou makest thy flock to rest<S>7257</S> at noon<S>6672</S>: for<S>4100</S> why should I be as one that turneth aside<S>5844</S> by the flocks<S>5739</S> of thy companions<S>2270</S>? <sup>as one: or, as one that is veiled</sup>
If thou know<S>3045</S> not, O thou fairest<S>3303</S> among women<S>802</S>, go thy way forth<S>3318</S> by the footsteps<S>6119</S> of the flock<S>6629</S>, and feed<S>7462</S> thy kids<S>1429</S> beside the shepherds'<S>7462</S> tents<S>4908</S>.
I have compared<S>1819</S> thee, O my love<S>7474</S>, to a company of horses<S>5484</S> in Pharaoh's<S>6547</S> chariots<S>7393</S>.
Thy cheeks<S>3895</S> are comely<S>4998</S> with rows<S>8447</S> of jewels, thy neck<S>6677</S> with chains<S>2737</S> of gold.
We will make<S>6213</S> thee borders<S>8447</S> of gold<S>2091</S> with studs<S>5351</S> of silver<S>3701</S>.
While the king<S>4428</S> sitteth at his table<S>4524</S>, my spikenard<S>5373</S> sendeth forth<S>5414</S> the smell<S>7381</S> thereof.
A bundle<S>6872</S> of myrrh<S>4753</S> is my wellbeloved<S>1730</S> unto me; he shall lie<S>3885</S> all night betwixt my breasts<S>7699</S>.
My beloved<S>1730</S> is unto me as a cluster<S>811</S> of camphire<S>3724</S> in the vineyards<S>3754</S> of Engedi<S>5872</S>. <sup>camphire: or, cypress</sup>
Behold, thou art fair<S>3303</S>, my love<S>7474</S>; behold, thou art fair<S>3303</S>; thou hast doves'<S>3123</S> eyes<S>5869</S>. <sup>my love: or, my companion</sup>
Behold, thou art fair<S>3303</S>, my beloved<S>1730</S>, yea, pleasant<S>5273</S>: also our bed<S>6210</S> is green<S>7488</S>.
The beams<S>6982</S> of our house<S>1004</S> are cedar<S>730</S>, and our rafters<S>7351</S> <S>7351</S> of fir<S>1266</S>. <sup>rafters: or, galleries</sup>
